The Worker program at George Brown College focuses on developing students' capacity to work with Indigenous individuals, families, groups, and communities. Students in the program will have a year-long field experience in their second year for approximately 600 hours. Field education is supervised by qualified professional practitioners, and students are supported in securing their own placement experiences. George Brown maintains relationships with agencies throughout the Greater Toronto Area. All students are encouraged to complete a Vulnerable Sector Check before commencing field placements due to requirements from field partners. The fees for the checks vary by region and are paid by the student. Students who do not have clear Vulnerable Sector Checks may find their placement choices limited, and they are encouraged to work with the field education coordinator to identify alternatives or apply for Suppression and Destruction of Record or Record Suspension (formerly known as Pardon) at their regional police services. George Brown College Social Service Worker graduates meet the educational requirements for registration as a Social Service Worker in the Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers (OCSWSSW), with additional fees applying.
